decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board while putting pressure on the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Daze, while deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The inclusion of countermagic like Force of Will and Force of Negation helps protect the deck's creatures and spells, allowing it to maintain its aggressive tempo and secure a swift victory.

This deck utilizes the Death & Taxes archetype to disrupt opponents while maintaining a aggressive playstyle. It focuses on using cards like Recruiter of the Guard and Stoneforge Mystic to search for key creatures and equipment, while leveraging cards like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude to control the battlefield. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a Companion provides additional power and flexibility. The deck aims to generate value through efficient creature removal, disruptive spells, and tempo plays to pressure opponents and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of Gaea's Cradle and other land ramp cards to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for early plays of powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive creatures and spells to disrupt opponent's strategies, such as Collector Ouphe and Thoughtseize. Natural Order is a key card in the deck, allowing for easy access to powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth or Endurance. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through efficient mana generation and disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. Utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, along with removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out, the deck aims to control the board and protect its threats. Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide strong finishers, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student offers card advantage. The inclusion of Wasteland helps disrupt the opponent's mana base, and the deck's aggressive tempo strategy aims to close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with Dredge creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough, then use cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Golgari Thug to dredge through the deck for combo pieces. Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy help generate tokens and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Once the graveyard is filled, the player can use cards like Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Ox of Agonas for a game-winning play. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful graveyard-based combo strategy.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while quickly ramping into powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cast its Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule, overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive threats. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker to provide additional support and disruption, making it a formidable aggro deck in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use low-cost spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the game. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, Lightning Bolt, and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, along with land disruption from Wasteland, further emphasizes the deck's aggressive tempo strategy. Additionally, card selection and manipulation tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Mishra's Bauble help ensure the deck can consistently draw into the necessary resources for victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through cards like Rite of Flame, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Chrome Mox in order to cast spells like Gamble and Echo of Eons to search for or draw into key combo pieces. The deck aims to set up a win condition through cards like Grapeshot and Burning Wish while utilizing cards like Defense Grid and Artist's Talent to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck combines elements of fast mana generation, card draw, and protection to enable a powerful storm combo.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck focuses on using cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur the combo pieces, while also using disruption like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. The deck also includes various utility cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to control the board and ensure the combo goes off successfully.

This deck focuses on quickly playing and utilizing artifacts, particularly with cards that benefit from or interact with artifacts in play. The strategy involves using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to accelerate mana production and take advantage of artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Pinnacle Emissary. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive artifact creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out a large number of spells in order to combo off and win the game in a single turn. The main win condition involves using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck, then reanimate Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck includes various forms of disruption like Thoughtseize and Pact of Negation to protect the combo, as well as cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to generate extra mana to cast spells quickly. The goal is to execute the combo as efficiently as possible to win before the opponent can respond.

The key focus of this deck is to control the board through disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also maintaining tempo with cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to apply pressure early with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Nethergoyf, while also presenting threats with Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig for key pieces, further enhancing the deck's aggressive game plan. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent casting of spells and to maximize the deck's efficiency.

The main concept of the deck is to disrupt the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and counter spells like Force of Will while developing a board presence with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Nethergoyf. The deck aims to maintain tempo by using cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower to keep the opponent off balance. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide card advantage and additional threats, while cards like Fatal Push and Wasteland help control the opponent's board. The deck also utilizes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to filter through the deck and find key cards.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while deploying threats quickly to apply pressure. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Hymn to Tourach, along with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will to control the game. Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters provide powerful threats, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student generates card advantage. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares can lock down the opponent's creatures, allowing you to push through damage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and control the game while presenting a fast clock to win before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around establishing a fast board presence with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer, Caves of Chaos Adventurer, and Undermountain Adventurer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Trinisphere and Chancellor of the Annex. The deck also uses mana acceleration tools like Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox to quickly cast powerful spells like Anointed Peacekeeper. The use of Cavern of Souls ensures that the deck's key creatures are uncounterable, allowing for a strong aggressive strategy that aims to win the game quickly.

This Bant control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantage through card draw and removal. It utilizes a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The deck also aims to generate value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Additionally, it has a toolbox of creatures like Endurance and Hullbreacher to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistency in hitting its mana requirements.
